revised_title: An In-Depth Study of Liver Structure and Development Across the Animal Kingdom
tldr: This article provides a detailed description of the structure and development of the liver in various animals. The author examines the liver's structure and function in different classes of the animal kingdom, including Bryozoon, Asterias, earthworms, leeches, insects, Arachnida, Crustacea, Mollusca, Fishes, Reptiles, Birds, and Mammals. The author concludes that the liver's structure is essentially parenchymal and discusses the development of the hepatic duct.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
